title: 2010 G20 Toronto summit
summary: The 2010 G20 Toronto summit was the fourth meeting of the G20 heads of state/government, to  discuss the global financial system and the world economy, which took place at the Metro Toronto Convention Centre in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, during June 26â€“27, 2010. The summit's priorities included evaluating the progress of financial reform, developing sustainable stimulus measures,[1] debating global bank tax,[2] and promoting open markets.[3] Alongside the twenty-one representatives of the G20 major economies, leaders of six invited nations, and eight additional intergovernmental organizations also took part in the summit.
